intro: Spergularia diandra var. tenuifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of pink or white flowers, which are typically borne on elongated pedicels. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal or inland dune environments. Spergularia diandra var. tenuifolia is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
